intro: Microlicia chamaepitys, commonly known as the dwarf pittosporum, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with leathery, dark green leaves. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. Microlicia chamaepitys is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
